sentence.Network_en: She put the letter on the desk in front of me, her face deadpan, not a flicker of a smile.
sentence.Network_cn: 她把那封信放在我面前的桌子上，故意一脸严肃，没有一丝的笑容。

sentence.Network_en: Some people don't catch his deadpan humor, that makes it even funnier.
sentence.Network_cn: 有些人不能了解他那种无表情的幽默, 因此更有趣.

sentence.Network_en: I gave him a deadpan look said, so much I walked upstairs.
sentence.Network_cn: 我面无表情地瞪了他一下说道, 说完我就快步上楼去了.

entry.tran: (幽默）冷面的；(开玩笑或作弄人时）故意板着脸的，一脸严肃的
entry.def: Deadpan humour is when you appear to be serious and are hiding the fact that you are joking or teasing someone.
